title: en.wikipedia.org_wiki_Culture_Convenience_Club
transformers_text:
Culture Convenience Club Company, Limited ( カルチュア・コンビニエンス・クラブ株式会社 , Karuchua Konbiniensu Kurabu Kabushikigaisha ) is a Japanese company that operates Tsutaya (蔦屋), a chain of video rental shops and bookstores throughout Japan, Taiwan and China. [ 1 ] [ 6 ] The company is headquartered in Ebisu, Tokyo . [ 7 ] The stock of the company was formerly listed in the first section of the Tokyo Stock Exchange ( TYO : 4756 ), but it has since been delisted following a management buyout in 2011. [ 8 ]

As of December 2013, the company and its franchisees operate 1,461 Tsutaya rental shops in Japan. [ 9 ]

The T Card, the membership card of Tsutaya, works as a platform for a cross-industry loyalty program . As of May 2010, more than 35 million holders of the card earn "T Points" at FamilyMart , Book Off , Lotteria , and so forth as well as Tsutaya shops. [ 10 ] [ 11 ]

On 17 March 2017, the company acquired magazine publishing brand Tokuma Shoten . The deal was expected to be completed at the end of March. [ 12 ] In September 2017, the Culture Convenience Club signed a deal with China's CITIC Press Group to create a joint cultural content distribution platform. [ citation needed ]
